New Records: Elly De La Cruz became the 3rd player in MLB history to have 100 stolen bases in their first two big league seasons, joining Rickey Henderson and Vince Coleman.
Elly De La Cruz joined the 100 steals/100 extra-base hits club in his first two seasons in the big leagues, achieving this faster than any other player.
Elly De La Cruz tied the club record for strikeouts in a season with 206 and then surpassed it.
Elly De La Cruz passed up the Atlanta Braves for the most steals on the season with 65.
Elly De La Cruz is tied with the Minnesota Twins for the most steals on the season with 65.
Key Match Events: Elly De La Cruz had a record-setting night for the Reds, achieving multiple records and milestones in the game against Pittsburgh.
Post-Match Reflections: Votto4life expressed that it's a shame the Reds will likely trade Elly De La Cruz in a couple of years, as they will never get equal value for him.
MBS suggested that the Reds should approach Elly De La Cruz with extension talks at the end of the season, or sign a big FA to play alongside him for the next 5 years.
Votto4life believes that Elly De La Cruz will get a shocking payday when he becomes a free agent and will end up with a big market team.
Pseudo GM thinks that trading Elly De La Cruz for 'prospects' is not smart baseball, as he is a franchise player and the cornerstone for building a club.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Elly De La Cruz's record-setting night was compared to Eric Davis's impressive season in 1986, where he had 27 homers and 80 steals in just 132 games.
Elly De La Cruz's baseball IQ is an underrated part of his equation, as mentioned by Mauired.
The Reds' ownership group's involvement in trading Elly De La Cruz was questioned by mac624, who thinks that a young Gen X Billionaire could change their thinking.
The Reds' decision to trade Elly De La Cruz was compared to the Angels' handling of Shohei Ohtani by Votto4life.
Others: Elly De La Cruz's agent advises against 1 or 2 year extensions, making it a tough sell for the Reds to keep him.
Elly De La Cruz's speed is off the chart, but his baseball IQ is also an important part of his game, as mentioned by Mauired.
Elly De La Cruz's steal success rate is 80.2%, which is still very good, as mentioned by Dan.
Elly De La Cruz's chances of scoring more runs than any Red in the 2000's are discussed by Old-school, who thinks he could score more than any Red since Larkin and Davis.
